title: Fluffy Chocolate Buttercream Frosting Recipe
description: Butter, powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and heavy cream are whipped together into this light and fluffy chocolate buttercream frosting you can use to frost any cake or cupcakes.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Frostings and Icings Chocolate Fluffy Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 4.2 (5) 4 Reviews 3 Photos Light and fluffy chocolate frosting, suggested by my friend Linda. Spread over any cake and smooth out bubbles. Submitted by Tim Tyler Updated on September 23, 2022 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 10 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 32 Yield: 4 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 32 servings 4 cups powdered sugar 1 ½ cups unsalted butter, softened ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1 pinch salt 4 tablespoons heavy whipping cream Directions Combine powdered sugar and butter in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Add cocoa powder, vanilla, and salt; mix for 30 seconds. Add cream 1 tablespoon at a time, mixing after each addition. Scrape down the sides of the bowl. Mix on medium speed until frosting is shiny and seems to have large bubbles, 3 to 5 minutes more. Add Your Photo Photos of Fluffy Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 01 of 03 Photo by  Jennifer Baker 02 of 03 Photo by  Natasha Titanov 09/13/2022 03 of 03 Photo by  Jennifer Baker 03/17/2022 This is great, just be sure the butter is softened but still cool-not melted. I use vanilla bean paste instead of extract, but this makes a great frosting! 1 You’ll Also Love Homemade Chocolate Frosting 101 Ratings Buttermilk-Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 5 Ratings Perfect Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 7 Ratings Best Ever Nutella Frosting 4 Ratings Basic Chocolate Buttercream Icing 55 Ratings The Best Chocolate Glaze 106 Ratings Creamy Chocolate Frosting 2,420 Ratings Granny's Mahogany Cake and Frosting 12 Ratings Coffee Butter Frosting 226 Ratings Guinness Chocolate Cake with Irish Cream Frosting 10 Ratings Chocolate Fudge Buttercream Frosting 637 Ratings White Chocolate Buttercream 2 Ratings One Bowl Buttercream Frosting 252 Ratings Food Processor Chocolate Whipped Cream Frosting 89 Ratings Chocolate Cupcakes with Cream Cheese-Oreo-Buttercream Frosting 8 Ratings Strawberries and Cream Buttercream 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Tim Tyler
instructions: Combine powdered sugar and butter in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Add cocoa powder, vanilla, and salt; mix for 30 seconds. Add cream 1 tablespoon at a time, mixing after each addition. Scrape down the sides of the bowl. Mix on medium speed until frosting is shiny and seems to have large bubbles, 3 to 5 minutes more.
